definition: to thresh grain (on the floor)
dozen (loanword)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: Now let's go play some baseball.
sentences.chinese: 現在，讓我們去打場棒球吧。

sentences.english: But we can definitely have a snow fight .
sentences.chinese: 反正打場雪仗是絕對不成問題。

sentences.english: I just wanted to play well for myself.
sentences.chinese: 我只是想爲自己打場好球。

sentences.english: Would you like to play tennis with me before going home？
sentences.chinese: 回家前和我打場網球怎麼樣？

sentences.english: If history is anything to go by, Obama might be in for a rough ride.
sentences.chinese: 按照“歷史經驗”，奧巴馬可能要打場硬仗。

sentences.english: I could have just really got it rolling.
sentences.chinese: 我原本可以打場好球的。

sentences.english: I don't feel like studying tonight. Let's go to a hockey game.
sentences.chinese: 我今晚不想讀書，讓我們打場曲棍球吧。

sentences.english: We must take this good opportunity to fight an excellent eradication battle.
sentences.chinese: 我們一定要把握好時機，打場漂亮的攻殲戰。

bastard/scoundrel/rogue

to get straight to the point (idiom)
to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support

definition: lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to boast
female gossip/busybody
bullheadedness/stubborn
to make eyes/to wink

protective coloration/camouflage
lit. to drive a duck onto a perch (idiom)/fig. to push sb to do sth way beyond their ability
